content:
Diagnosis:
Metastatic sigmoid adenocarcinoma with micropapillary features
T4bN2M1, HER2 amplified, MSI-high
Peritoneal metastases and retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy

Previous treatment:
January 2024 - Emergency Hartmann's procedure
February-April 2024 - 4 cycles FOLFOX/Trastuzumab

Current medications:
Ondansetron 8mg prn
Dexamethasone 4mg bd
Aprepitant protocol

Current situation:
Completed cycle 4 FOLFOX/Trastuzumab

CT 15 May 2024 shows stable peritoneal disease but new small volume retroperitoneal nodes

CEA rising from 45 to 89

Performance status remains 1

I reviewed [redacted name] today following completion of 4 cycles FOLFOX/Trastuzumab. While initial response was encouraging with symptomatic improvement and CEA reduction, recent imaging shows mixed response with stable peritoneal disease but emergence of new retroperitoneal nodes. CEA has also shown upward trend. Given MSI-high status and evidence of disease progression, we will now transition to pembrolizumab monotherapy. I have explained the rationale and potential benefits of immunotherapy in detail.

The plan is to commence pembrolizumab 400mg q6weekly. First treatment scheduled for next week. We will arrange CT reassessment after 4 cycles. Blood tests including thyroid function will be monitored regularly. [redacted name] understands to report any new symptoms promptly, particularly those that might indicate immune-related adverse effects.

Follow up arranged in 3 weeks with blood tests including thyroid function, liver function, and tumor markers.

cancer_timeline.value: CT shows stable peritoneal disease but new small volume retroperitoneal nodes
Discontinuing FOLFOX/Trastuzumab due to disease progression

patient_facts.value: CT 15/05/24 shows stable peritoneal disease with new retroperitoneal nodes

status_updates.value: Metastatic sigmoid cancer showing mixed response to FOLFOX/Trastuzumab with disease progression in retroperitoneal nodes. Changing to pembrolizumab based on MSI-high status
Mixed response with stable peritoneal disease but new retroperitoneal nodes and rising CEA
Changing from FOLFOX/Trastuzumab to pembrolizumab 400mg q6weekly
CT reassessment after 4 cycles of pembrolizumab, regular monitoring of thyroid function, liver function, and tumor markers
Review in 3 weeks with blood tests
